00578 typedef struct ft_handle_devices {

00600         unsigned int query_time;
00602         unsigned char interface_connected;
00603 } *FT_HANDLE;

00619                                                 // Numbers from GetFtDeviceTyp()
00620 #define     NO_FT_DEVICE                0       // No ft Device connected
00621 #define     FT_AUTO_TYPE                1       // Search for Device
00622 #define     FT_INTELLIGENT_IF           10      // FT-Intelligent Interface connect (serial)
00623 #define     FT_INTELLIGENT_IF_SLAVE     20      // FT-Intelligent Interface with Extension connect (serial)
00624 #define     FT_ROBO_IF_IIM              50      // FT-Robo Interface with Intelligent-Interface-Modus connect (serial)
00625 #define     FT_ROBO_IF_USB              60      // FT-Robo Interface connect with USB-Port
00626 #define     FT_ROBO_IF_COM              70      // FT-Robo Interface connect with COM- (serial-) Port
00627 #define     FT_ROBO_IF_OVER_RF          80      // FT-Robo Interface connect over RF-Data-Link
00628 #define     FT_ROBO_IO_EXTENSION        90      // FT-Robo I/O-Extension
00629 #define     FT_ROBO_RF_DATA_LINK        110     // FT-Robo RF Data Link
00630 #define     FT_MAX_TYP_NUMBER           999     // Max Typ Number
00631 
00632 
00633 #define     FT_ANALOG_CYCLE             5       // Standard: 5*Read Digital Inputs, then EX, EY
00634                                                 // Only for old Intelligent Interface { for OpenFtCommDevice() }
00635 
00636 
00637 #define     PORT_NONE                   0
00638 #define     PORT_COM                    1       // Standard: COM1
00639 #define     PORT_COM1                   1
00640 #define     PORT_COM2                   2
00641 #define     PORT_COM3                   3
00642 #define     PORT_COM4                   4
00643 #define     PORT_USB                    50

00645                                                 // Moduletypes for Robo Interface
00646 #define     MODULE_NOT_INSTALLED        0       // Not installed
00647 #define     MODULE_RF1                  1       // RF Data Link Module is installed
00648 
00649 
00650 #define     LEN_STRG1                   30      // Length of SN / FW Strings
00651 #define     LEN_STRG2                   255     // Length of Name-Strigs
00652 #define     ANZ_DISTANCE_TYPES          2       // Number of supported Distance-Modes
00653 #define     LEN_DIST_TYPE_NAMES         30      // Lenght of Mode-Names
00654 #define     LEN_DIST_VAR_NAMES          20      // Lenght of Variable-Names
00655 #define     NAME_LEN                    85      // Lenght of Prog-Names
00656 
00657 
00658 #define     MEM_FLASH1                  0       // Use Memory FLASH-1 Block
00659 #define     MEM_FLASH2                  1       // Use Memory FLASH-2 Block
00660 #define     MEM_RAM                     2       // Use Memory RAM Block
00661 #define     MEM_NO_ACCESS               -1      // No Memory Select (for SetFtProgramActiv() )
00662 #define     DOWNLOAD_PROG_NAMELEN       80      // Max. 80 characters/bytes for the programname
00663 
00664                                                 // Values for "dwParameter" from DownloadFtProgram() 
00665 #define     PROG_TYP_NORMAL             1       // Program can bei Start with Software and Switch
00666 #define     PROG_TYP_AUTOSTART          2       // Program is startable at Power-On
00667 
00668 
00669                                                 // COM-Modes for SetFtDeviceCommMode()
00670 #define     IF_COM_ONLINE               1       // Online Mode
00671 #define     IF_COM_MESSAGE              3       // Messagemode
00672 #define     IF_COM_DATA                 4       // Datatransfer
00673 #define     IF_COM_PARAMETER            5       // Get Mode
00674 
00675 
00676                                                 // Message-System
00677 #define     MSG_HWID_SELF               0       // Message for himself
00678 #define     MSG_HWID_SER                1       // Message for the Robo-Interface serial port
00679 #define     MSG_HWID_RF                 2       // Message for other Interfaces (over RF)
00680 #define     MSG_HWID_RF_SELF            3       // Message for other Interfaces (over RF) and for himself (back over RF)
00681 
00682 #define     MSG_BUFF_SER                1       // SER-Messagebuffer (for ClearRfMessage() )
00683 #define     MSG_BUFF_RF                 2       // RF-Messagebuffer (for ClearRfMessage() )
00684 #define     MSG_BUFF_SELF               4       // SELF-Messagebuffer (for ClearRfMessage() )
00685 
00686 #define     MSG_SEND_NORMAL             0       // Message send "normal"
00687 #define     MSG_SEND_OTHER_THAN_LAST    1       // Message send "if not the same as the last message"
00688 #define     MSG_SEND_IF_NOT_PRESENT     2       // Message send "if not present in the send buffer"
00689

00694 #define     IF_DS_INPUT_DISTANCE        1       // Distance
00695 #define     IF_DS_INPUT_TOL_STD         20      // Toleranz (Standard)
00696 #define     IF_DS_INPUT_REP_STD         3       // Repeat (Standard)

00700     #pragma pack( push, 1 )
00701     typedef union
00702     {
00703         BYTE    aucMsg[6];
00704 
00705         struct 
00706         {
00707             BYTE    ucHwId;       
00708             BYTE    ucSubId;       
00709             BYTE    ucB0;
00710             BYTE    ucB1;
00711             BYTE    ucB2;
00712             BYTE    ucB3;
00713         } B;
00714 
00715         struct 
00716         {
00717             BYTE    ucHwId;       
00718             BYTE    ucSubId;       
00719             USHORT  uiMsgId;        
00720             USHORT  uiMsg;
00721         } W;
00722 
00723         struct 
00724         {
00725             BYTE    ucHwId;       
00726             BYTE    ucSubId;       
00727             DWORD   dw;
00728         } L;
00729     } SMESSAGE;
00730     #pragma pack( pop )

00739     // Important: 
00740     // Initialise all unused Variables in this Structure with "NULL"
00741     //
00742     // Every Time the driver reads new information from the Device
00743     // the Library checks this structure 
00744     typedef struct _NOTIFICATION_EVENTS 
00745     {
00746         // Callback-Procedure
00747         DATA_UPDATE_CALLBACK NotificationCallback;  // Pointer to the Callback-Procedure
00748         void* Context;                              // Pointer to the Context for the Callback-Procedure
00749 
00750         // for SetEvent()
00751         HANDLE hEvent;
00752 
00753         // for posting a Message (PostMessage() with wParam & lParam = 0)
00754         HWND    WindowsHandle;                      // handle to the destination window
00755         DWORD   Message;                            // message ID
00756 
00757 
00758         // Callback-Procedure for Messaging
00759         MSG_UPDATE_CALLBACK     CallbackMessage;    // Pointer to the Callback-Procedure for Receiving Messages
00760 
00761     } 
00762     NOTIFICATION_EVENTS;

00767     typedef struct _FT_SERIAL_NUMBER
00768     {
00769         DWORD   dwSn;                   // actually Serial Number at Power On
00770         DWORD   dwSn1;                  // Serial Number-1
00771         DWORD   dwSn2;                  // Serial Number-2
00772         DWORD   dwSnAktiv;              // Serial Number Activ (1/2) for next Power On
00773     } FT_SERIAL_NUMBER;

00777     typedef struct _FT_DISTANCE         // Robo Interface Distance Sensor
00778     {
00779         unsigned char   aDistModeNames[LEN_DIST_TYPE_NAMES];    // RO   Names for the Modes  
00780 
00781         DWORD           dwEnableDisVal1;                        // RO   1=Ask for Distance Value 1
00782         unsigned char   aDisVal1Name[LEN_DIST_VAR_NAMES];       // RO   Value 1 Name
00783         DWORD           dwDisVal1;                              // RW   Value 1
00784 
00785         DWORD           dwEnableDisVal2;                        // RO   1=Ask for Distance Value 2
00786         unsigned char   aDisVal2Name[LEN_DIST_VAR_NAMES];       // RO   Value 2 Name
00787         DWORD           dwDisVal2;                              // RW   Value 2
00788 
00789         DWORD           dwEnableDisVal3;                        // RO   1=Ask for Distance Value 3
00790         unsigned char   aDisVal3Name[LEN_DIST_VAR_NAMES];       // RO   Value 3 Name
00791         DWORD           dwDisVal3;                              // RW   Value 3
00792 
00793         DWORD           dwEnableDisVal4;                        // RO   1=Ask for Distance Value 4
00794         unsigned char   aDisVal4Name[LEN_DIST_VAR_NAMES];       // RO   Value 4 Name
00795         DWORD           dwDisVal4;                              // RW   Value 4
00796 
00797         DWORD           dwEnableDisVal5;                        // RO   1=Ask for Distance Value 5
00798         unsigned char   aDisVal5Name[LEN_DIST_VAR_NAMES];       // RO   Value 5 Name
00799         DWORD           dwDisVal5;                              // RW   Value 5
00800 
00801         DWORD           dwEnableDisVal6;                        // RO   1=Ask for Distance Value 6
00802         unsigned char   aDisVal6Name[LEN_DIST_VAR_NAMES];       // RO   Value 6 Name
00803         DWORD           dwDisVal6;                              // RW   Value 6
00804 
00805         DWORD           dwEnableDisVal7;                        // RO   1=Ask for Distance Value 7
00806         unsigned char   aDisVal7Name[LEN_DIST_VAR_NAMES];       // RO   Value 7 Name
00807         DWORD           dwDisVal7;                              // RW   Value 7
00808 
00809         DWORD           dwEnableDisVal8;                        // RO   1=Ask for Distance Value 8
00810         unsigned char   aDisVal8Name[LEN_DIST_VAR_NAMES];       // RO   Value 8 Name
00811         DWORD           dwDisVal8;                              // RW   Value 8
00812     } FT_DISTANCE;

00815 
00816     typedef union _FT_SETTING
00817     {
00818         struct                              // RO = Read Only, RW = Read / Write
00819         {
00820             DWORD   dwIfTyp;                // RO   Type of connected Device
00821                                             //      possible Values:       
00822                                             //          NO_FT_DEVICE            no answer from the Device - is it gone ?
00823                                             //          FT_INTELLIGENT_IF       FT-Intelligent Interface connect (serial)
00824                                             //          FT_ROBO_IF_IIM          FT-Robo Interface with Intelligent-Interface-Modus connect (serial)
00825                                             //          FT_ROBO_IF_USB          FT-Robo Interface connect with USB-Port
00826                                             //          FT_ROBO_IF_COM          FT-Robo Interface connect with COM- (serial-) Port
00827                                             //          FT_ROBO_IO_EXTENSION    FT-Robo I/O-Extension
00828                                             //          FT_ROBO_RF_DATA_LINK    FT-Robo RF Data Link
00829                                             //             FT_ROBO_IF_OVER_RF   FT-Robo Interface connect over RF-Data-Link
00830 
00831                                             // Serial numbers section
00832             DWORD   dwSn;                   // RO   actually Serial Number at Power On
00833             DWORD   dwSn1;                  // RW   Serial Number-1             (only FT-Robo Products)
00834             DWORD   dwSn2;                  // RO   Serial Number-2             (only FT-Robo Products)
00835             DWORD   dwSnAktiv;              // RW   Set Serial Number Activ (1/2) for next Power On
00836 
00837             DWORD   dwFw;                       // RO   Is Firmware Version for this product (only FT-Robo Products)
00838 
00839             unsigned char aSnStrg[LEN_STRG1];   // RO   String with Serialnumber    (only FT-Robo Products)
00840             unsigned char aSn1Strg[LEN_STRG1];  // RO   String with Serialnumber1   (only FT-Robo Products)
00841             unsigned char aSn2Strg[LEN_STRG1];  // RO   String with Serialnumber2   (only FT-Robo Products)
00842             unsigned char aFwStrg[LEN_STRG1];   // RO   String with Firmware        (only FT-Robo Products)
00843             unsigned char aSNaStrg[LEN_STRG2];  // RO   String with Short-Name      (only FT-Robo Products)
00844             unsigned char aLNaStrg[LEN_STRG2];  // RO   String with Long-Name       (only FT-Robo Products)
00845 
00846             DWORD   dwFwRoboIfVerAtLibIsMade;   // RO   Robo-If Firmware Version as this Lib is made
00847             DWORD   dwFwIoExtVerAtLibIsMade;    // RO   IO-Extension Firmware Version as this Lib is made
00848             DWORD   dwFwRfDataVerAtLibIsMade;   // RO   RF-DataLink Firmware Version as this Lib is made
00849             unsigned char aFwRoboIfVerAtLibIsMadeStrg[LEN_STRG1];   // RO   String with Robo-If Firmware Version as this Lib is made
00850             unsigned char aFwIoExtVerAtLibIsMadeStrg[LEN_STRG1];    // RO   String with IO-Extension Firmware Version as this Lib is made
00851             unsigned char aFwRfDataVerAtLibIsMadeStrg[LEN_STRG1];   // RO   String with Rf-Data-Link Firmware Version as this Lib is made
00852                                             
00853             DWORD   dwReserved;                 // Reserved for later use 
00854 
00855 
00856                                                 // Output Section
00857             DWORD   dwOutputAutoOff[4];         // RW   M1=[0]...M4=[3] Energy saver: 
00858                                                 //      "1" = "Power Off" motor driver when both outputs logical "0" (reduces Energy)
00859                                                 //      "0" = do not automatically disable the motor driver
00860             DWORD   dwOutputPwmType;            // RW   PWM-Type (Today only "0" supported)
00861 
00862 
00863                                                 // Robo Interface Distance Sensor
00864             DWORD   dwAnzDistanceModes;         // RO   Number of supported Distance Modes (Array Entries)
00865             DWORD   dwDistanceMode;             // RW   Type and Mode for Distance-Sensor (Index-Number in the range 0...ANZ_DISTANCE_TYPES)
00866             FT_DISTANCE     sDistance[ANZ_DISTANCE_TYPES];  // RW   Values for setting
00867                         
00868 
00869                                                         // Robo Interface Memory Section
00870             DWORD           dwProg[3];                  // RO   1=Program is saved in the Memory block; [0]=Flash-1 [1]=Flash-2 [2]=Ram
00871             unsigned char   aProgNames[3][NAME_LEN];    // RO   [0]=Flash-1 Prog Name; [1]=Flash-2 Prog Name; [2]=Ram Prog-Name
00872             DWORD           dwF1AutoStart;              // RO   1=Autostart Flash-1 programm, 0=no autostart
00873 
00874 
00875                                                 // Robo Interface Module Section
00876             DWORD           dwMod1Typ;          // RO   Type of left Module (only Robo-If)
00877             DWORD           dwMod2Typ;          // RO   Type of right Module (only Robo-If)
00878                                                 //      possible Values:       
00879                                                 //          MODULE_NOT_INSTALLED    No Module is installed
00880                                                 //          MODULE_RF1              RF Data Link is installed
00881 
00882             unsigned char   aMod1Strg[LEN_STRG1];   // RO   String with Module-1 Name   (only FT-Robo Products)
00883             unsigned char   aMod2Strg[LEN_STRG1];   // RO   String with Module-2 Name   (only FT-Robo Products)
00884 
00885 
00886                                                 // Robo Interface & RF Data Link Section
00887             DWORD   dwRfOn;                     // RW   0=disable RF  1=Enable RF
00888             DWORD   dwRfChannel;                // RW   Channel-Number (2..80) for RF-Communication 
00889             DWORD   dwRfSubChannel;             // RW   Sub-Channel of Device for the specified Channel (1..3)
00890             DWORD   dwRfMessage;                // RW   0=Disable Message-Router Function 1=Enable Message-Rounter Function
00891             DWORD   dwRfWrite;                  // W    0=write values permanent (FLASH); 1=write values temporary (RAM) 
00892             DWORD   dwRfFw;                     // RO   Firmwareversion of RF-Module
00893             unsigned char aRfFwStrg[LEN_STRG1]; // RO   String with Firmware of RF-Module 
00894 
00895                                                 // Information for the PC-RF Module
00896             DWORD   dwRfStopTransferOnError;    // RW   1=Stop the RF-Transfer Thread on bad RF Connection
00897 
00898                                                 // Information for the Interface RF-Module
00899             DWORD   dwRfMotorOffOnError;        // RW   1=Motor Off on bad RF Connection
00900         } sIf;
00901     } FT_SETTING;

00944     DWORD __stdcall     StopFtProgram(FT_HANDLE hFt);
00945     DWORD __stdcall     DeleteFtProgram(FT_HANDLE hFt, DWORD dwMemBlock);
